The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"l+Zc63N7nVlVVpBZaqTFI91FjlyRokk8MEprRXBP+qI="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"vIDHhI63o4kPlPl5uSPbZgcxM58T7J3dRVz4hpfVKl4="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"DXuHgUFAOkS9eiC4OI/DFjmFcj2SLpC7KH3wUAO8hAk="}

Part-time Role
Competitive

About this role
Department: Product & Engineering
Location: Hybrid / Remote
Reports To: Head of Engineering / CTO

About the Role
We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities
1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

3. API & Backend Integration
Integrate RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and backend services for user profiles, loyalty point logic, rewards catalog, notifications, etc.

Manage data flow using state management frameworks (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, MobX, GetX).

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3589,"metadataSeparator":"

Part-time Role
Competitive

About this role
Department: Product & Engineering
Location: Hybrid / Remote

About the Role
We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities
1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3589,"metadataSeparator":"

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"RrUpfvvEcuAOGPl+SCgLGjYeWrHr731jqgaJXgGDKak="}

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"NgOpxWFN3Fw//i5s9rpUT/0ID9nwlydLAL5lI1dkm90="}

Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"YWzH5KsHdVhA54qFPn5CO22cLuFTh7l7UJ/Gio1qsTQ="}

We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities
1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

3. API & Backend Integration
Integrate RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and backend services for user profiles, loyalty point logic, rewards catalog, notifications, etc.

Manage data flow using state management frameworks (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, MobX, GetX).

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"F0XKljoj6nxadX5hoB+6vJLSRP8ivk9y6GXRHkyp63o="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Competitive

80 days to apply

About this role
Department: Product & Engineering
Location: Hybrid / Remote
Reports To: Head of Engineering / CTO

About the Role
We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities
1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

3. API & Backend Integration
Integrate RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and backend services for user profiles, loyalty point logic, rewards catalog, notifications, etc.

Manage data flow using state management frameworks (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, MobX, GetX).

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.

How to Apply
Please submit:

Your CV

Portfolio or GitHub/Play Store/App Store links

A brief introduction of previous Flutter projects","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3805,"metadataSeparator":"

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"DmHZdDDaLINaY6ZMjbqQoNDEOzPxYFCl3D4/kp7w7h8="}

Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"17Uh4+Z/EaG33xoOmnweLuu0L85S/Vx2CZXbGqyyftQ="}

About the Role
We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

3. API & Backend Integration
Integrate RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and backend services for user profiles, loyalty point logic, rewards catalog, notifications, etc.

Manage data flow using state management frameworks (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, MobX, GetX).

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.

About this role
Department: Product & Engineering
Location: Hybrid / Remote
Reports To: Head of Engineering / CTO

About the Role
We are building a next-generation digital loyalty ecosystem and mobile app, integrating Web2 user experience with Web3-ready identity (NFT-based), reward tracking, and seamless partner integrations.
We are seeking a talented Front-End Flutter Developer to lead the development of a sleek, high-performance mobile experience across iOS and Android.

You will work closely with the product team, backend engineers, and UI/UX designers to bring our loyalty platform to life, focusing on responsive UI, smooth animations, consistent branding, and scalable architecture.

Key Responsibilities
1. Front-End Development
Build, test, and deploy high-quality Flutter applications for iOS and Android.

Implement clean architecture, modular code, and reusable UI components.

Develop features for user onboarding, point earning, redemption, NFT identity display, account management, and partner marketplace browsing.

2. UI/UX Implementation
Convert Figma or design system components into pixel-perfect Flutter interfaces.

Ensure consistent brand experience across all screens and transitions.

Work with designers to refine micro-interactions, animations, and layout responsiveness.

3. API & Backend Integration
Integrate RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and backend services for user profiles, loyalty point logic, rewards catalog, notifications, etc.

Manage data flow using state management frameworks (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, MobX, GetX).

Ensure smooth performance with efficient caching, pagination, and error handling.

4. Performance & Reliability
Optimize app speed, memory usage, and load times.

Conduct app profiling, debugging, and quality assurance testing.

Implement CI/CD pipelines for builds and releases (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, etc.).

5. Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, backend, and QA teams.

Produce documentation for components, architecture, and feature logic.

Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and agile delivery.

Required Skills & Qualifications
Some experience building Flutter apps (iOS + Android).

Strong proficiency in Dart, widgets, state management, and Flutter architecture.

Experience integrating REST APIs, Firebase services, authentication flows.

Strong understanding of responsive design, animations, and UI best practices.

Knowledge of testing frameworks (unit, widget, integration).

Experience with app store deployment (App Store, Google Play).

Familiarity with clean architecture or MVVM patterns.

Preferred / Bonus Skills
(Not required but highly advantageous)

Experience working with loyalty programs, e-commerce apps, fintech, or digital wallets.

Understanding of NFT metadata, blockchain wallet integration, or Web3 user flows (reading only; no trading functionality).

Experience with analytics tools (Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel).

Knowledge of security standards for mobile apps (encryption, secure storage).

Experience with push notifications, deep linking, and dynamic content.

What We Offer
Opportunity to build a flagship loyalty app from the ground up.

Work on innovative digital identity and gamification experiences.

Flexible working environment with creative freedom.

Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech ecosystem.

Competitive salary and performance incentives.

Your CV

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"CMXVUfLKDx2Be2At8Pv9ovkgcAoQMSLAOAKCC+goQws="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"lODZKQASpHJbBAAX22D76joybpL5N2qbKRM8ZZ8UJ60="}

Avco Systems Ltd. is a modern, growing Software Development business based in Slough, UK.

We work with some of the largest businesses in the UK and help them develop, support, maintain and host their large software projects. We have a sharp focus on client satisfaction, rapid feedback and ongoing improvement, so we are looking to grow our team with some forward thinking, enthusiastic people that will help continue to drive the business forward.

We have been building software for over 30 years. Over that time we have supported dozens of students in gaining real-world experience in software engineering and writing code for production systems. Guided and mentored by the whole engineering team, students on placement at Avco work on, and make significant contributions to, multiple important and interesting projects throughout the year.

If you're passionate about technology and enjoy the challenges of working in a varied role then you could be just who we're looking for.


What's it like to work with us?
You'll work closely with a great team of fun, but focused, like-minded Software Engineers and IT Ops colleagues. Grow your skills and experiment with new tools, techniques and technologies on a wide variety of projects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in as much of the lifecycle of projects as you are comfortable with; from client requirement gathering right through development to delivery and hosting.


Why should you join?
We are always looking for the right people to join our team of knowledgeable, friendly and forward-thinking individuals, and there's plenty of reasons why you should consider joining us:

Excellent job security - we've been growing for 30 years and have maintained a consistent financial growth year-on-year.
Room to grow - all voices are heard, and anyone can expand beyond their job role.
Stay in shape for free - with our onsite gym, or tennis/basketball courts right outside.
Good location - ample parking and walking distance to the well-connected Slough train station.
Games room - unwind with a game of pool, table tennis, board games, Xbox and more.
Latest technology - take the opportunity to stay at the forefront of the IT industry and experiment with new technologies.
Remote working – welcome to work from home or come to the office as much as you feel comfortable with, wherever you feel most productive.

What are we looking for?
A genuine and demonstrated passion for programming and problem solving.
Strong academic performance so far on a Computer Science (or related) degree, and  on course for at least a 2:1 final grade.
Hands on knowledge and understanding of:
At least one programming language such as Java, C#, or Go.
Basic web technologies like HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
SQL and databases.
Unit testing and debugging code.
Source control systems such as Git.
Understanding of computer science fundamentals such as data structures, design patterns, and the software development lifecycle.

What will you be doing?
Throughout your placement you will be working within engineering teams delivering a variety of software projects to our clients.

Implementing new features by writing high quality, unit tested, code.
Debugging and fixing defects and bugs within existing code.
Engaging in our peer review and continuous integration processes.
Assisting with requirements analysis and scoping of new projects.
Assisting in deploying and supporting applications in our data centre and within cloud service providers.
Communicating directly with clients and attending client meetings.
If you think we're a good fit for you then don't hesitate to get in touch with us.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3941,"metadataSeparator":"

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"CYsF8M1TxPGYwGBzFnXgxPIrduac8NIAp3Od9T59WrY="}

Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"hTXdkdG0sbqmN+SrhoW3c3BrsBq8m7zfT1qTMWbwzI8="}

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave 
Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing 
You will be responsible for
Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave 
Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing 
You will be responsible for
Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"B4TiOj+BIxDUhItbbD9q+uKNxckMAA2sWhhYUZljsw4="}
