Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"qJMeNkDEDqVfCRI1dtduiRVm7AFeV8jUw3nY7/SmLSA="}

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.

Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.

Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.

9f2b9212-d772-48a0-9657-f6343023c30a.__data__: {"id_":"9f2b9212-d772-48a0-9657-f6343023c30a","metadata":{"source":"recon_strategy","versionHash":"70b72b0dda58063a4ed387d8e5bf0eed11359dd56d68285ca948b4a6a5c607e6","persistedAt":"2025-12-17T00:30:46.988Z"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"recon-strategy","metadata":{"source":"recon_strategy","versionHash":"70b72b0dda58063a4ed387d8e5bf0eed11359dd56d68285ca948b4a6a5c607e6","persistedAt":"2025-12-17T00:30:46.988Z"},"hash":"vLtALIkyOXJXGuI4kDyGIp+hZ1OwW26+VORJ5fqYLtI="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"6e3ac565-3cb7-4685-b55c-1bd8c315306b","metadata":{},"hash":"OwUREJXterjdVjg1By/qc0jgpBjCOy/yC0D/KPtZ4BE="}},"text":"***# Strategic Reconnaissance: Research and Customisation for Executive Cold-Email Outreach## 1. The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave 
Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing 
You will be responsible for
Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

We never ask for money during our hiring process. Any request for payment made in the name of Tesco is not legitimate. Please report suspicious activity to candidatecare@tesco.com

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"a07xQ0D4qe5IyAeboDAOjkAXC3By951rPIkapntFC2E="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave 
Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing 
You will be responsible for
Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.

Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.

Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies

The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave

Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Phase III: Personal Value Audit (Analyzing Your \"Solution\")**CV Reframing:** CV is not a history; it is a \"database of solutions.\"**4.1 Quantification:*** Replace responsibilities with *measurable achievements*.* *Weak:* \"Responsible for sales.\"* *Strong:* \"Closed 20% of daily cold calls; exceeded quota by 30%.\"**4.2 STAR Method:*** Structure achievements via **S**ituation, **T**ask, **A**ction, **R**esult. Create a \"bullet point library.\"**4.3 Personal Value Proposition (PVP) Matrix:*** Synthesize: [Target Need] + [Competitor Baseline] + [Your Unique Offer] = PVP.## 5. The Synthesis: Mapping Solution to Problem**Methodology:** Invert the standard process. Do not spray CV.1.  Select Target.2.  Find Problem (Phase I).3.  Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. I built a similar territory for [Competitor], generating [Metric]...\" (Benefit).**Tactical Examples:*** *Target CTO:* Problem = React Migration. Solution = \"I led a 6-month React migration avoiding [Specific Pitfall].\"* *Target VP Sales:* Problem = Efficiency. Solution = \"I automated lead-gen funnels saving 20 hours/month.\"## 6. Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).","textTemplate":"","endCharIdx":3742,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"sRrPZm230NLIOVeTU9wfDwPkIoXsLlY7xYLqnDWnRM8="}

Pitfalls and Filtration**Category 1: Unnecessary (Discard):*** **Pleasantries:** \"Hope you are well\" (Wasted space/insincere).* **Generic Praise:** \"Love your company.\"* **Self-Centred:** \"My name is...\" (Name goes in signature).**Category 2: Dangerous (Strategic Risk):*** **PAS Model (Problem-Agitate-Solution):** \"Agitation\" must be diplomatic in UK context. Risk of sounding arrogant if \"Problem\" is misidentified.* **Outdated Info:** referencing old data/roles destroys credibility immediately.**Category 3: Fatal (Technical/Legal):*** **NO CV ATTACHMENTS:** #1 red flag for spam filters and security. **Solution:** Hyperlink LinkedIn profile in signature.* **Deliverability:** Must use authenticated domain (SPF/DKIM) and warmed-up sender reputation.* **Cultural Fails:** American spelling (Color/Center) in UK context alienates audience.* **Legal (UK GDPR/PECR):**    * B2B cold email is legal via PECR.    * Personal work emails (name@company) fall under GDPR.    * **Lawful Basis:** \"Legitimate Interest.\" Requires targeting, relevance, and easy Opt-Out. Deep research provides the justification for Legitimate Interest.## 7. Conclusion* **Research = Strategy.** 125 words is the summary of hours of reconnaissance.* **Process:** Find Corporate Problem $\\to$ Find Executive Hook $\\to$ Map Personal Solution.* **Execution:** Eliminate pleasantries. Avoid \"Unforced Errors\" (Attachments/Spelling).* **Final Output:** A concise narrative proving value in the first sentence, bypassing the \"Time-Waster\" filter.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":3048,"endCharIdx":5132,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"8xL+KEF+u6oIXco1womIAfhpuxTZSgfMW/KXW/Quq78="}

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you

Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

About the role
 
The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more!

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

8c60fdba-7292-4b28-b21c-0652507786f2.__data__: {"id_":"8c60fdba-7292-4b28-b21c-0652507786f2","metadata":{"source":"recon_strategy","versionHash":"70b72b0dda58063a4ed387d8e5bf0eed11359dd56d68285ca948b4a6a5c607e6","persistedAt":"2025-12-17T01:48:50.681Z"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"recon-strategy","metadata":{"source":"recon_strategy","versionHash":"70b72b0dda58063a4ed387d8e5bf0eed11359dd56d68285ca948b4a6a5c607e6","persistedAt":"2025-12-17T01:48:50.681Z"},"hash":"UVyvI7+K4mninjJE4vsjvHuFZhGaMOCXzq48+F5ol7c="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"fec54651-f96b-437f-8fd7-880e9bcbf11f","metadata":{},"hash":"OwUREJXterjdVjg1By/qc0jgpBjCOy/yC0D/KPtZ4BE="}},"text":"***# Strategic Reconnaissance: Research and Customisation for Executive Cold-Email Outreach## 1. The Research Mandate: \"Job-Seeker\" vs \"Consultant-of-One\"**Paradigm Shift:** Cold outreach fails when adopting a \"job-seeking\" mindset (perceived as supplicant/cost-centre). Success requires reframing as a \"Consultant-of-One\" pitching high-value solutions.**The Executive Filter:*** Executives are \"time-poor.\"* Primary Filter: \"Is this a time-waster?\" NOT \"Is this person qualified?\"* **Requirement:** Deep research is the only mechanism to signal executive-level empathy and strategic alignment.**Strategic Brevity:*** **Ideal Length:** 50–125 words.* **Forcing Function:** This constraint forces strict filtration. Only data proving \"What's In It For Them\" (WIIFT) survives.* **Goal:** Discard terabytes of data to find single, high-impact \"Problem/Solution\" narrative.## 2. Phase I: Corporate Reconnaissance (Finding the \"Problem\")To pitch a solution, one must possess expert-level understanding of the target's \"Pains\" and \"Gains.\"**2.1 Macro View (Strategic Intent):*** **Sources:** Annual Reports (Chairman's Statement, Risk Factors), Investor Relations, CEO Keynotes.* **Goal:** Identify explicitly stated \"challenges,\" \"headwinds,\" and \"strategic priorities.\"**2.2 Micro View (Operational Pain Points):*** **Gap Analysis:** Compare Macro goals with operational reality.* **Open Job Postings (Gold Mine):** A single role = a need. A pattern of roles = a strategic pain point (e.g., 15 open CX roles = Customer Experience crisis). Keywords in job descriptions reveal the bottlenecks (e.g., \"Salesforce,\" \"Migration\").* **Customer Feedback:** User reviews/forums reveal external pains the company struggles to solve.**2.3 Ideal Customer Profile (ICP):*** Identify the specific decision-maker who \"owns\" the problem (e.g., VP of Sales, CTO), not just the CEO.## 3. Phase II: Executive Profiling (Finding the \"Hook\")**Goal:** Establish genuine connection; prove email is not mass-automation.**Mapping the Public World:*** Sources: LinkedIn posts, recent interviews, podcasts, specific project launches.**The \"Hook-to-WIIFT\" Bridge:*** **Avoid:** Generic compliments/Fake Flattery (\"I loved your post\").* **Execute:** Bridge specific content to sender's value.* *Formula:* \"Your article on [Topic] resonated, as I recently solved [Topic] at [My Company] resulting in [Metric].\"## 4. Select matching \"Solution\" from PVP Matrix (Phase III).**Crafting the WIIFT:*** **Bad:** \"I have 10 years experience...\" (Feature).* **Good:** \"Saw you are expanding EMEA. The Analytics Capabilities team consists of the Analytics Product Managers, Data and Business Intelligence Analysts, Software Developers and Implementation Architects. The team is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, user behavioural data tracking and optimisation capability. The Analytics Implementation squad, where this role sits, is within this team. The squad focuses on enabling more informed and faster decisions by designing new analytics implementations and re-implementations, raising the implementation coverage across core sites alongside data quality enhancements.

This position will suit a Javascript Web Developer that would be interested in working on data manipulation and data engineering. Working with strings, numbers, arrays, structured object to structure, filter and javscript algorithms for best performance. Knowledge in Web standards and security is must have.
What is in it for you
We’re all about the little helps. That’s why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you – both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more! 
Annual bonus scheme of up to 20% of base salary 
Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus Bank holidays) 
Private medical insurance 
26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years’ service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 4 weeks fully paid paternity leave 
Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing 
You will be responsible for
Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of Tesco as a business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:

Coding, QA and configuration of analytics tracking code.
Implement TMS (GTM) changes. Support advance platforms implementation through TMS.
Integrate data sources via web APIs.
Follow a data quality assurance process, including implementation, measurement and user acceptance testing.
Transfer knowledge of the business processes and requirements to the development teams.
Collaboration with Product, Development, Content, Marketing teams to collect business requirements and translate into effective tracking requirements.
This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.
You will need
Advanced knowledge in Web Technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript – whilst you are not going to be coding a full website and its features, we are coding core tracking methods in JavaScript with proper release cycles. Array and object manipulation, JSON data handling and other advanced methodologies and concepts. Strong working knowledge of Security for webpages, privacy and cookies. Able to write clean, readable and performant code.
Considerable digital experience working on tracking implementations for Adobe and Google Analytics 4 and their respective Javascript APIs.
Technical knowledge of Adobe and Google Analytics is essential. How it works under the hood, how to implement on eCommerce platforms and how to debug and verify own work
Solid grasp of digital analytics industry, tools and working practices.
Prior experience in providing Analytics requirement for native mobile apps, able to demonstrate clear process for QA and sign-off – tools and methodologies
Experience of using analytics, data storage, data processing and business intelligence tools – SQL, BigData is a bonus.
Personal

Strong communication skills with people of different skills and levels.
Flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
Ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud
We never ask for money during our hiring process. Any request for payment made in the name of Tesco is not legitimate. Please report suspicious activity to candidatecare@tesco.com
About us
Our vision at Tesco is to become every customer's favourite way to shop, whether they are at home or out on the move. Our core purpose is ‘Serving our customers, communities and planet a little better every day’. Serving means more than a transactional relationship with our customers. It means acting as a responsible and sustainable business for all stakeholders, for the communities we are part of and for the planet. 
 
We are proud to have an inclusive culture at Tesco where everyone truly feels able to be themselves. At Tesco, we not only celebrate diversity, but recognise the value and opportunity it brings. We're committed to creating a workplace where differences are valued, and make sure that all colleagues are given the same opportunities. We’re proud to have been accredited Disability Confident Leader and we’re committed to providing a fully inclusive and accessible recruitment process.
